author: Staff Reporter
text:
Sambia Sohrab, the main accused in the hit-and-run case in which an Air Force official was killed, was arrested late on Saturday night. A court here on Sunday remanded him in police custody for 14 days.

Mr. Sambia, son of former Rashtriya Janata Dal MLA from West Bengal Mohd. Sohrab, who recently shifted loyalties to the Trinamool Congress (TMC), was arrested from Beckbagan in the south-eastern part of the city. The TMC leadership, however, denied any association with him.

“He was arrested around 11 p.m. on Saturday while going to his in-laws’ house in the Beckbagan area,” Joint Commissioner (Crime) of Kolkata Police Debashish Boral told The Hindu .

Mr. Sambia has been charged under various sections of the IPC, including 302 (Murder), 307 (Attempt to Murder) and 120 B (Criminal Conspiracy). Mr. Sohrab was allegedly behind the wheel of an Audi car that ran over 21-year-old Air Force official Abhimanyu Gaud on Wednesday.
title: Prime accused in hit-and-run case arrested
